com.deltadna.android.sdk

Class DDNA

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.deltadna.android.sdk.DDNA

  • public final class DDNA
extends Object
    Singleton class for accessing the deltaDNA SDK.

    The singleton instance must first be initialised by calling initialise(Configuration) from a Application's Application.onCreate() method. Following this call an instance can be accessed at any time through instance().

    Prior to sending events, or performing engagements, the SDK must be started through startSdk() or startSdk(String). stopSdk() should be called when the game is stopped.

    To customise behaviour after initialisation you can call getSettings() to get access to the Settings.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DDNA.Configuration
      Class for providing a configuration when initialising the SDK through initialise(Configuration) inside of an Application class.
      static interface  DDNA.SettingsModifier

      • instance

      • startSdk

        public DDNA startSdk()
        Starts the SDK.

        This method needs to be called before sending events or making engagements.

        Returns:
        this DDNA instance

      • startSdk

        public DDNA startSdk(@Nullable
                     String userId)
        Starts the SDK.

        This method needs to be called before sending events or making engagements.

        Parameters:
        userId - the user id, may be null in which case the SDK will generate an id.
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance

      • stopSdk

        public DDNA stopSdk()
        Stops the SDK.

        Calling this method sends a 'gameEnded' event to Collect, disables background uploads and automatic session refreshing.

        Returns:
        this DDNA instance

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Queries the status of the SDK.
        Returns:
        true if the SDK has been started, else false

      • newSession

        public DDNA newSession()
        Changes the session id.
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance

        Records an event with Collect.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the event
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the name is null or empty

      • requestEngagement

        public DDNA requestEngagement(String decisionPoint,
                              EngageListener<Engagement> listener)
        Makes an Engage request.

        The result will be passed into the provided listener through one of the callback methods on the main UI thread, even if this method was called from a background thread.

        Parameters:
        decisionPoint - the decision point for the engagement
        listener - listener for the result
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the decisionPoint is null or empty

      • requestEngagement

        public <E extends Engagement> DDNA requestEngagement(E engagement,
                                                     EngageListener<E> listener)
        Makes an Engage request.

        The result will be passed into the provided listener through one of the callback methods on the main UI thread, even if this method was called from a background thread.

        Parameters:
        engagement - the engagement
        listener - listener for the result
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the engagement is null

      • upload

        public DDNA upload()
        Sends pending events to our platform.

        This is usually called automatically, but in the case that automatic event uploads are disabled the game will be responsible for calling this method at suitable points in the game flow.

        Returns:
        this DDNA instance

      • getUserId

        @Nullable
public String getUserId()
        Gets the user id.
        Returns:
        the user id, may be null if the user id hasn't been set or generated by the SDK at this point

      • setUserId

        public DDNA setUserId(@Nullable
                      String userId)
        Sets the user id.

        Will be applied next time the SDK will be started.

        Parameters:
        userId - the user id, may be null in which case the SDK will generate a user id internally.
        Returns:
        this DDNA instance
